edu.arizona.biosemantics.semanticmarkup.markupelement.description.ling.learn.lib

Class OTOLearner

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.arizona.biosemantics.semanticmarkup.markupelement.description.ling.learn.lib.OTOLearner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ILearner

    public class OTOLearner
extends java.lang.Object
implements ILearner
    OTOLearner learns by reading from an IVolumeReader and learning using an ITerminologyLearner For learning, additional input is read from an IOTOClient Moreover, learned results are handed to an IOTOLiteClient This can be used for the first and hence the 'learn' application for the iPlant integration
    Author:
    rodenhausen

      • fetchStructureTerms

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> fetchStructureTerms(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> mainTerms,
                                                                  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>>> synonymTerms,
                                                                  java.util.Set<java.lang.String> labelSet)
                                                           throws java.lang.Exception
        this procedure seems to be slow and only a handful of terms are filtered. 1. search db for candidate structure terms 2. apply heuristic rules to filter the terms 2.1 pos = v|adv 2.2 does not ... 2.3 by [means] of 3. filtered terms are not displayed and they will not be saved to wordroles table as "os" or "op". 4. terms filtered by 2.1.adv or 2.3 will be saved in NONEQTERMSTABLE 5. cache results to reduce cost
        Parameters:
        synonymTerms -
        mainTerms -
        labelSet -
        Returns:
        filtered candidate structure words
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • fetchCharacterTerms

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> fetchCharacterTerms(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> mainTerms,
                                                                  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>>> synonymTerms,
                                                                  java.util.Set<java.lang.String> labelSet)
                                                           throws java.lang.Exception
        1. search db for candidate character terms 2. apply heuristic rules to filter the terms 2.1 pos = adv 2.2 by [means] of 3. filtered terms are not displayed and they will not be saved to wordroles table as "os" or "op". 4. terms filtered by 2.1.adv or 2.2 will be saved in NONEQTERMSTABLE 5. cache results to reduce cost
        Parameters:
        synonymTerms -
        mainTerms -
        labelSet -
        Returns:
        filtered candidate character words
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • populateDescriptorList

        private void populateDescriptorList(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> words,
                                    java.lang.String w,
                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> mainTerms,
                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>>> synonymTerms,
                                    java.util.Set<java.lang.String> labelSet)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        w is put into words only if it is a word it is not a pronoun, a stopword, a preposition, an adv (-ly), or -shaped it is not in the glossary if it is in the glossary, get its role from glossary and save it in wordroles table.
